error.signature: fatal: [host]: UNREACHABLE! => {"changed": false, "msg": "Failed to connect to the host via ssh", "unreachable": true}
error.regex: (?i)UNREACHABLE!.*(?:Failed to connect|Connection refused|timed out|No route to host)

verdict.summary: Ansible cannot reach the target host via SSH. Common causes include incorrect SSH credentials, network connectivity issues, host key verification failures, or the SSH service not running on the target.

dead_ends.why_fails: This disables SSH host key verification entirely, creating a security vulnerability to MITM attacks. It also does not fix connectivity or credential issues.

dead_ends.action: Increasing timeout values without investigating the root cause
dead_ends.why_fails: If the host is genuinely unreachable (wrong IP, firewall, SSH not running), no amount of timeout increase will succeed â€” it just delays the failure

workarounds.action: Verify SSH connectivity manually and fix credentials
workarounds.how: Test SSH manually: ssh -vvv user@host. Check that the SSH key or password is correct, the host IP/DNS resolves, port 22 is open (nc -zv host 22), and the SSH service is running on the target.
If the target is behind a bastion, set ansible_ssh_common_args='-o ProxyJump=bastion_user@bastion_host' in the inventory. Verify the bastion host is accessible first.

leads_to.condition: when SSH credentials are expected from environment variables that are not set

preceded_by.condition: when missing SSH key environment variables cause connection failure

frequently_confused_with.distinction: ansible-unreachable is a runtime connectivity failure; secret-not-found is a CI configuration issue where secrets are not passed to the workflow
